Class FileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileSystem
  • public class FileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a file system containing directories and files. Allows operations such as creating, deleting, moving, and listing files and directories.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FileSystem()
      Constructs a new FileSystem with a root directory named "root" and a current directory named "home" within the root.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void changeDirectory​(java.lang.String newPath)
      Changes the current working directory to the specified path.
      FileSystemElement createFD​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String name)
      Creates a new file or directory with the specified name and type in the current directory.
      boolean delete​(java.lang.String input)
      Deletes the file or directory with the specified name from the current directory.
      java.lang.String findPath​(FileSystemElement current)
      Finds the path of the given file system element till the home directory.
      Directory getCurrentDirectory()
      Retrieves the current working directory of the file system.
      Directory getRoot()
      Retrieves the root directory of the file system.
      void listContent​(java.lang.String space)
      Lists the content (files and directories) of the current directory.
      boolean move​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String newDirectoryPath)
      Moves a file or directory with the specified name to the new directory.
      void printTree()
      Prints the hierarchical representation of the file system starting from the root directory.
      FileSystemElement search​(java.lang.String name)
      Searches for a file system element with the specified name starting from the root directory.
      void sort()
      Sorts the files and directories in the current directory by their creation date and time.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSystem

        public FileSystem()
        Constructs a new FileSystem with a root directory named "root" and a current directory named "home" within the root.

    • Method Detail

      • createFD

        public FileSystemElement createFD​(java.lang.String type,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        Creates a new file or directory with the specified name and type in the current directory.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the file system element ("f" for file, "d" for directory)
        name - the name of the file or directory to be created
        Returns:
        the created file system element

      • printTree

        public void printTree()
        Prints the hierarchical representation of the file system starting from the root directory.

      • search

        public FileSystemElement search​(java.lang.String name)
        Searches for a file system element with the specified name starting from the root directory.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file system element to search for
        Returns:
        the found file system element, or null if not found

      • findPath

        public java.lang.String findPath​(FileSystemElement current)
        Finds the path of the given file system element till the home directory.
        Parameters:
        current - the file system element for which to find the path
        Returns:
        the path of the file system element til the home

      • listContent

        public void listContent​(java.lang.String space)
        Lists the content (files and directories) of the current directory.

      • sort

        public void sort()
        Sorts the files and directories in the current directory by their creation date and time.

      • changeDirectory

        public void changeDirectory​(java.lang.String newPath)
        Changes the current working directory to the specified path.
        Parameters:
        newPath - the path of the directory to change to

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(java.lang.String input)
        Deletes the file or directory with the specified name from the current directory.
        Parameters:
        input - the name of the file or directory to delete
        Returns:
        true if deletion is successful, false otherwise

      • move

        public boolean move​(java.lang.String elementName,
                    java.lang.String newDirectoryPath)
        Moves a file or directory with the specified name to the new directory.
        Parameters:
        elementName - the name of the file or directory to move
        newDirectoryPath - the path of the directory to move to
        Returns:
        true if the move operation is successful, false otherwise

      • getRoot

        public Directory getRoot()
        Retrieves the root directory of the file system.
        Returns:
        the root directory

      • getCurrentDirectory

        public Directory getCurrentDirectory()
        Retrieves the current working directory of the file system.
        Returns:
        the current working directory
